bug.author: bwanaaa
bug.summary: running streamlit from a jupyter notebook error
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
using latest anaconda module not found error <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Enter these lines in jupyter notebook running from anaconda3 !pip install --user streamlit import streamlit as st <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior:</denchmark-h>
no error <denchmark-h:h2>Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>import streamlit as st</denchmark-h>
ModuleNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 import streamlit as st ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'streamlit' <denchmark-h:h2>Is this a regression?</denchmark-h>
no <denchmark-h:h1>Debug info</denchmark-h>
-streamlit version File "", line 1 Streamlit version ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax Python 3.7.4 pip win 10 chrome latest <denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
I get the same error when I try to execute thecode from spyder (the anaconda python ide) In [1]: pip install streamlit In [2]: streamlit hello File "", line 1 streamlit hello ^ SyntaxError: invalid syntax This fellow tried to run streamlit hello from jupyter which failed as well <denchmark-link:https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/syntaxerror-invalid-syntax/536>https://discuss.streamlit.io/t/syntaxerror-invalid-syntax/536</denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bwanaaa>@bwanaaa</denchmark-link> , Streamlit cannot be run from within a Jupyter notebook nor from within an interpreter. It must be run from the operating system's command line environment after you've done pip install streamlit within a virtual environment. Ironically, you linked to a forum post in which someone tried to run streamlit hello within jupyter "which failed as well" because it will never work. The answer on the forum post you linked to is still the correct answer. :) You should use Anaconda to open a terminal. Run pip install streamlit inside that terminal, and streamlit hello inside that terminal as well. Thanks for your question -- I hope the answer helps!
